items.sentence: Last night I saw a very interesting movie about World War II.
Tom will quite likely spend the rest of his life behind bars.
Tom might've been the one who did this, but I don't think so.
Tom is in the conference room, getting ready for the meeting.
Tom asked the guy at the gas station to clean his windshield.
I told Tom who I thought would like to go to Boston with him.
I suspect Tom and Mary are the ones who told John to do that.
I suspect Tom and Mary are the ones who told John about that.
I don't think that Tom realized just how much Mary loved him.
I don't think that Tom knows when Mary will leave for Boston.
I don't think that Tom and Mary are ever going to be friends.
Tom didn't know Mary was going to be at the party last night.
Tom and Mary said that they hoped to be back by October 20th.
Both Tom and Mary weren't at home when we went to visit them.
That's not the main reason that Tom shouldn't have done that.
You ought to tell Tom that you aren't planning on doing that.
You know that Tom is still planning on doing that, don't you?
Tom is still planning to have a party the day after tomorrow.
Where would you like to live after you graduate from college?
Tom is in a bad mood today, so you should stay away from him.
